Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor hit a grand slam in the sixth inning, leading the New York Mets to a 4-1 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies.
David Peterson earned the win with 2.1 innings pitched, allowing 2 hits and no earned runs.
Edwin Diaz secured the save with 1 inning pitched, allowing no hits and striking out 2 batters.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was held at Citi Field in Queens, New York, with an attendance of 44,103.
The New York Mets won the series 3-1 and advanced to the NLCS.
